result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheena Jean Fleischman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*3 days of jail credit 
*Jail Sentence to be served in the Portage County Jail

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

*Comply with the conditions of probation in her Marathon County Case 20CF1276
*Submit DNA Sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheena Jean Fleischman

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule

10:21 a.m.  Defendant Sheena Jean Fleischman in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Sheena Jean Fleischman.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Pfeil states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1:  Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.

ADA Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Soule makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Impose but STAY Jail Sentence of 90 Days in the Portage County Jail
3 Days of Jail Credit 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 1 Year -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with all conditions of probation in Marathon County Case #20CF1276
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 10/14/2022 at 10:00 a.m. - Parties have reached an agreement

Filed by the State:  PTC set 5-31-22 @ 9:00 in Br 3 
   Please remove the current PTC from the calendar and set for a new
   date. Atty Soule is unavailable for the current date.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:31 PM Defendant Sheena Jean Fleischman appeared in court, Attorney Taylor O Soule appeared in court for Sheena Jean Fleischman, Attorney Brian J Pfeil appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:12 PM Defendant Sheena Jean Fleischman in court with Attorney (Atty) Taylor O Soule. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Soule's client wishes to waive her preliminary hearing.
Atty Soule to e-file a written waiver and then the preliminary hearing can be removed from the calendar.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Initial Appearance set for January 31, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
Follow all open bond conditions

1:14 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping - Felony.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $250 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Atty Soule provides the address for the defendant.
Court adopts the $250 signature bond as requested by the State with conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  January 31, 2022  @ 1:45 p.m.  in Branch 1
